review_content: I bought a switch solely for this game. It unites the old with the new. I used to play animal crossing on the game cube when I was younger and any releases from then until now didn't interest me until this one. It hits all the bars bringing back important features from the past but also bringing in new ones to add game play. The graphics are amazing and really brings back childhood memories. I've been playing for about 2 weeks now and I'm completely hooked. Whether you've been an animal crossing gamer or are new to the universe I HIGHLY recommend this game to take you away from the world and unwind in a game that is just so relaxing.
title: Bringing Back My Childhood

author: maifun
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2021
review_content: ACNH has become one of my almost daily little breaks. I haven't yet gotten into the online part, but for a while now I've been enjoying running around my island and building up my bank account, making friends with most of my villagers (while politely trying to weed out the few I don't like, lol), decorating my house, now I'm finally doing the whole terraforming of my island. So much fun! I love those little weirdo animals that habitate my island with me :) I just wish it were easier to see the overview of my island from above, like grid-style, while I'm re-doing it... and, that things could be placed on a diagonal... and ,that items only took up as much space as they look like they take, meaning we could put some things closer next to each other... and.... oh well. Still lots of fun!
title: So much fun, no pressure

author: Palm Tree
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
review_content: There is a lot of momentum going for the game at the beginning, which drives you to keep playing. There's a good sense of progression, until you realize that the few things you've already come to discover on the island are ALL THAT IS THERE TO DO on the island. As you continue to pay off home loan after home loan, new construction after construction, you feel like just another cog in the hive machine. This game is just a time suck, with not many redeeming qualities past its charming appearance and cute animal neighbors (which start to say the same things over and over again after a while). Avoid it like the plague if you value the time in your life. Don't make the same mistake I did, and waste hours and hours on it.
title: Problematic

author: Cody Schott
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2020
review_content: There is only one island per switch console, meaning multiple accounts must play on the same island. Yet, nintendo does nothing to adjust for the increase player load on the "story" and resources of the island. Each tree still only gives 3 wood per day, each rock gives however much it gives before it gets exhausted per day. Even worse, only the "lead" player gets to participate in the story, and gets the DIY recipes from the story. Any secondary family member who plays on the same switch, because most families have only one switch and one copy of the game, plays as a second class citizen.I have seen multiple reviews pointing out this flaw, but acting as if it is not fatal. That the single player experience still merits a fantastic review. That is entirely wrong. The game is totally broken for me because I share a switch with someone else and it makes it a dreadful experience. It should be fixed right away.
title: Single island, multiple players is one of the biggest shams

author: Jay R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020
review_content: Such a fun little game, I tried this game first on my niece's console and this game actually made me buy my own Nintendo Switch! Be prepared to invest in ours and hours of creativity to craft your own personal island. Now I know why the Animal Crossing series is so popular! On a side note, it's funny how there are some whiny people giving this game such a bad score simply because they can't have multiple islands on one console. I don't recall it saying anywhere in the game promos or materials that this was even a feature! If you want multiple islands, don't be a cheapskate and buy your own Nintendo Switch like I did!
title: I can't stop playing!

author: Colin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2020
review_content: So far the game is fine if you are playing by yourself. I wanted to play with my 7 year old daughter in multiplayer thinking we could both contribute to the advancement of the game. Not so. This is really a single player game where the other person is just there to follow you around. They way they have limited this game on the Switch is very deceiving and I bet the fallout will continue for a while. The one island limit and each of us not being able to have our own island or that only the player who made the island can actually advance it makes this not a multiplayer game and frankly it's deceptive.
title: Deceptive to say this is multiplayer

author: Kwhyle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2020
review_content: I got this for my daughter and the entire family was bored in hours. It is basically chore simulator devoid of any challenge. Save your money. Buy a box of Cheerios, dump them onto the ground, pick them up and repeat. Same experience.
title: Incredibly Boring

author: Jimmy L Champion
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2020
review_content: Ive tried every fix mentioned online and i have both copies of the game both download and cartridge and both will delete my game after a week or so of playing. It doesn't seem like Nintendo wants to do anything about it so buy it at your own risk knowing everything you work for may be gone who knows mines been a week it could delete it after several months of playing. Please fix this glitch or let us have access to our save files its a non competitive game after all.
title: Game file will be deleted at random.

author: Abayas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020
review_content: How good this game is means... nothing if I can't exercise my creativity in a "creativity-driven" game. I like having my own saves, making my own progress, doing things as I like. I cannot do this if I am forced to share my island with other players. I cannot arrange things as I like because my idea of an ideal island is very different from what the individual I am sharing my switch with thinks is ideal.What's that? That man is SHARING his switch with his significant other? What AUDACITY! No, he must purchase a second switch if he desires to enjoy his own save file!If you know ANYTHING about tech or even save files then you should recognize this is either a cash-grab or a 'because I said so' move on Nintendont's part. It's a game. Let us have fun. There's nothing switch-like about this form of file management. Killjoys.
title: I have to share MY island?

author: G August
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
review_content: My family has been playing Animal Crossing since Population Growing on the GameCube. It’s been an incredibly relaxing game to play, an excellent stress reliever! My oldest child not only has anxiety, but has been anxiously awaiting a game that isn’t a shooter, or multiple dangerous enemies you have to watch out for. There is already so much to do from the get go, and the whole family gets excited when something new happens. The art style has improved incredibly since the last installment of the game, and it makes great use of the Switch’s larger engines. With the game being released around the time of the pandemic, it’s an amazing reason to stay inside and keep busy.
title: Family Favorite

author: Andy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2020
review_content: The game is so fun, only problem we didn't know prior to buying the game is that you can only have one island per switch console, all users have to share the same island and the first player that started the game became the island representative which dictate how to design the island. We should have do more research before buying the game. Other than that, it has bought us a lot of joy in the 2 weeks that we have the game, maybe too much joy, our family spend way too much time than we should playing this game.
title: please be warned, this game is super addictive, in a good way.

author: Roshan Bellavara
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2021
review_content: My 11 year old daughter loves this game and has played  with it every day for the last month and doesn’t seem to be getting tired of it yet. She visits her friend’s island (with a Nintendo membership), and enjoys the ability to play with friends. A great game. The only downside is it is a game where multiple plays can play, but only on the one island and only in the same island scenario. Basically, it’s a single player game which is disappointing because my 7 year old would like to play but since it was my daughter’s birthday gift, she won’t let him because he’d have to play in her island world she created. Disappointing that I’d have to buy another game for him.
title: Great but a one person game

author: dluccini1998
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2021
review_content: This has got to be the worst game ever.  It is crazy boring.  It is difficult to play as well.  You have to be a genius to figure out how to play with multiple people.  Kids have to debate who is in control in party mode.  Had to restart it because it never saved.  Do not buy!!!!  Epic fail.
title: Worst game ever

author: Hastings
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020
review_content: Fair warning for anyone not yet in the know, the game will only allow you one island per console.Now, multiple people can use the same island and any resources consumed or changes made are persistent for all members of the island.This means that if you're a parent who bought this game for multiple kids, you're gonna need to take the time to teach them to share and to resolve any disputes they have in ways they both benefit...  a potentially daunting task for most parents these days, but one that you should be teaching them anyway and if you havent you should probably be thanking this game for forcing the issue.Now if you're an adult household who shares a console and have already learned how to share but simply would rather stretch out and forge your own stress free island...  well, that's why I gave it 3/5 stars.
title: Time to learn to share

author: gary assassin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2020
review_content: It's good to have a relaxing, non stressful game to play after Frostpunk, Tis War Of Mine and Fallout 76 on the PS4.What I did not like about this game was the long dialog with interacting characters and the pause when starting a conversation. I wish there was a way to speed past these.Other than that, I like the low stress quests and system of reward for milestones. I like having a goal to upgrade your house and surroundings.Sometimes I just need to get away from the realities of life or worse, the stressful alternate realities of other video games.
title: A relaxing video game

author: Shannen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2020
review_content: Defenetly a great animal crossing game, however I have some big gripes with how they handle local multi player. The follower  not being able to do much at all kinda sucks, and you can't have more than one island on a console. Overall it really is a great game but I don't understand the reasons for the followers being severely limited in local co-op, and only 1 island. It could have been so much better.
title: Great, but I have some issues

author: anthony
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020
review_content: If this was a single player experience, 5 stars easy. Unfortunately, I got a copy for myself and for my 2 nieces and nephew so I could play with they live in a separate state. I've been having a great time, them, not so much. They are fighting, yelling, screaming and crying because the leader keeps "popping" them where they don't want to go. My sister fixed it by having them only play 1 at a time so local multiplayer is a useless feature in my opinion. I've been visiting my oldest niece's character and decided to visit the younger one but it turns out you can't just link 1 Nintendo account to all users on the switch and use the paid subscription to do any multiplayer unless you are the main player of the game. My oldest niece had to clear out her inventory so they wouldn't mix up what's her and her's sister after the younger one visited me with her sister's character. It was such a headache to call them up and try to help them over the phone to only realize they couldn't do it and we had to figure something else out.Personally, I give it 5 stars for the single player since it's a slightly better version of the previous games. I've been enjoying myself and so have my nieces. Just NEVER TOGETHER (remember this rule and it will save your family a massive headache).  This was suppose to be a positive review but knowing the experience my sister and brother-in-law went through, I'm compensated the rating. It's like older animals crossing games except now you're locked to 1 island per console instead of 1 town per cartridge but $260-$360 is far more expensive than just an additional $50-$60. I can get why people would be mad. I hope Nintendo fix the "Call Resident" issue or just get rid of it altogether. My oldest niece who is 8 mentioned "Why isn't it like Mario Kart with the split screen?!" and I had to tell her, "It's complicated?"
title: 5 star for single player 1 star for multiplayer.

author: Kokanut Pixels
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2020
review_content: A HUGE plus for giving people more to do and for continuing to support the game!The crafting system is pretty fun! It gives you reasons to explore yours and other random islands.So many custom designs! I do wish each player/character got their own list of designs.Could use improvements on buttons used to do things. Sometimes multiple functions for the same button gets in the way, like picking things up and erasing tiles, or using an item and shaking a tree.I don't play the game much, but it could use a way to transfer saves to another Switch or cloud save in case your Switch gets stolen.
title: My roommate who never plays video games has 350+ hours into it.

author: PandaKoala
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2020
review_content: Did nintendo plan this to come out with a pandemic going on?? As an RN, this has been a fantastic stress relief during this time. It is 100% cute, 100% adorable, and 100% fun. Online play is wonderful, single person play is great as well. If you are questioning to get it, just go ahead click the button.I am very impressed with Nintendo with this game, probably one of their best ones.I appreciate updates being made and free for the game, for any potential glitches that might occur.
title: RN and Covid-19

author: Robin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2021
review_content: I see that ACNH has a lot of negative reviews because of the fact that it’s only one island per console. This doesn’t affect me personally because my boyfriend has his own Switch anyway. But before he had his own we played together on the same console and it was just fine. I can see it being a hassle for small children fighting over the Switch.As for the game itself it’s extremely fun and addicting. You have full customization of basically everything: your island is yours to design with every kind of furniture and decoration you can think of, you can buy and design lots of clothes, talk to cute animals, go to other people’s islands through multiplayer or dream addresses, fish, catch bugs, plant, even trade online. there’s a LOT to do and it’s doubtful you will be bored. I never played another Animal Crossing game before this one (I have New Leaf but I never got into it) and this game is amazing. I don’t even play my other Switch games. You may not like it if you only like fast paced combat games but you will love it if you like creative, building, relaxing games like Sims.
title: Amazing Game

author: Jiraiya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
review_content: I have never played an Animal Crossing game. When the trailers started coming out a month ago or so, I showed my kids and they were excited for it. Even though we are still early on, it has been great. It provides a simpler style to Minecraft, and is very cutesy/cartoony. Very charming, even my wife (who doesn't like video games) sat and watched as the three of us played. It is a great way for my kids to read while also playing a game they like.The single island per console limitation is an issue for most people, and I understand. My kids actually enjoy sharing the same island. Still, it's a pretty lame limitation that is one made by design.
title: Very Charming

author: Loh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2020
review_content: I love so much about this game, but there's a ton about it that makes it feel utterly unfinished, or at the very least poorly designed.All the new features introduced are wonderful. They enhance your ability to really make your island yours and include things AC fans have been clamoring for for years.But the removal of certain features that existed in previous installments, and the omission of some elements that would be easily implement (and sort of surprising that weren't) with the current technology really takes away from the game as a whole.I understand they'll be adding more content, but it really feels like there's a ton of oversight on features that are pretty standard in this day and age of gaming.
title: I love the game but would be lying if I didn't say I was a little disappointed.

author: laidback4sho
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2020
review_content: I will admit, I was on the fence about getting this game. Figured it was a little kid's game because of the cutesy characters and all. But I went ahead and got it, thinking I'd just give it to my granddaughter if I didn't like it. Boy am I glad I did!First of all, don't let the cutesy characters fool you. This game has depth! This game has humor! This game has a cult following for a reason. I would dare put this game in my top five favorite Switch games.If you're on the fence as I was, go ahead and get it. You won't regret it. It really is that good.
title: OMG this is a great game!!!

author: DustMan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2021
review_content: This is a great game for just winding down at the end of a hard day. You can express your creativity by building up your village/town/island, hunt for supplies, go fishing. Everything is just nice... and easy... and relaxing. Something honestly fun about that. This is a game that I can take a break from and then come back too and remember why I love playing it. I had never tried the series before but will be a return player.
title: Easy paced and fun game.

author: Mr. James
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
review_content: First of all, Thank you Amazon for delivering my game a day early.Having played the GameCube version, the Switch version is even better. Given the fact you can play it anywhere on the Switch is a big factor. There is so much to do, no time limits, absolutely no rush to finish tasks unless you're inclined to do so. During the Covid19 crisis, this game will help alleviate your stress and relax you. Nintendo made another great game, as they always do.If you're looking for a game to help pass the time, then ACNH is the obvious choice.
title: Very relaxing game, play anyway you like.

author: Interragator8746
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2020
review_content: Prior to previous Animal Crossing games, you can do most of the similar activities. (such as Now there are more features added like the DIY workshop where you get to craft or polish your tools. A smartphone given by Tom Nook for your needy guide apps. A goal mile point system that you can make about your achievements. New tools to get around your island. There are many ways to go spending your time in your island with your animal buddies and your friends from their islands.
title: Your own island to escape to

author: Honest Reviewer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021
review_content: This was our first Nintendo switch game and our first video game system for the kids (age 7/5) and they love it. There’s tons of you tube videos about it and a bit of a cult following.  For the switch Buy the optional docking station Bc this unit occasionally does not connect to your TV unless a series of ridiculous steps are followed (what you power on first or which wire gets connected first). Anyway we love the game. We call it the learning game Bc it requires them to read to understand what to do next
title: Great game

author: AMZing Kristen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2021
review_content: I love this game so much! Truth be known, I may be a little addicted. It’s just a very simple sweet game that I find to be relaxing and enjoyable. It is one of the few video games on the market today that parents do not have to worry about their children playing. The game is 100% kid friendly. It even teaches kids valuable life lessons, like saving money, prioritizing, cooperation…it is just filled with good stuff!This is my first Animal Crossings game, but I am guessing it won’t be my last!
title: Kid friendly & super fun!

author: Nmcf
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review_content: I got this game for my sister because she got a switch for her birthday.  We order the game together when it was first released and have played it a ton together.  Very nice to have her own island and copy of game and we can still play together.  Have put countless hours into this game and many memories with my sister :)
title: best game ever

author: Emily
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2020
review_content: This is such a good game. I’ve been a fan of the series for many years, and you don’t need to have played the others to play this one. Easy to understand controls, beautifully relaxing music that changes based on the weather and time, The dialogue consists of cute conversation starters that really illustrate how much the developers care about the individual playing the game. My daughter falls asleep to the jazzy music and that’s a big plus, too!
title: Unbelievably charming

author: J.T. Shaver
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2021
review_content: For single player, this is a really fun game for kids. The multiplayer always requires 1 person to be the "leader", so you can imagine how that goes when 2+ kids are playing and all want to be in charge, because the non-primary players can't do much, and are at the mercy of the leaders movements and decisions.
title: Fun game, not the best multiplayer

author: Austin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2020
review_content: Nintendo does it again! As a massive fan of Animal crossing and a long time player I can say this is one of the best animal crossings in a long time. Surprisingly I see more similarities in New Horizons to the game cube version of the game, seeing similar features and special events some of which haven’t been seen since then. Unlike some people, I think this has the best multiplayer options of any animal crossing. Not only can you send letters to your friends online but you can also visit in real time with one another via the airport. And you can do that with up to SEVEN OTHER PLAYERS at the same time. You can also couch co op with family and friends as you work together to make your island beautiful together. The graphics are softer and very beautiful. There has never been so many clothing and furniture items it’s almost overwhelming but I love it. It’s clear they took the fans of the series into account on making this one. There are so many little details that really make this game so great.
title: Long Time Fan Review

author: kevin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2020
review_content: This game is fantastic. Best in the series. It’s everything you love about animal crossing with a great deal of additional content/features/grinds. If it’s your first time, enjoy! Rich in content, engaging play and the terraforming is addictive. Nintendo is crushing it this generation with it’s killer apps and this is no different. Buy this game.
title: The Pinnacle of the Series.

author: Kayt Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2021
review_content: Came earlier than expected, good condition! Love this game, fun for alot of ages! My 6 yr old niece plays, my 11 yr old step daughter plays, alot of my ault friends both male and female play. The connectivity is awesome, being able to bond with friends and family far and near with a relaxing fun game like this one. Lots of crafting, gathering, design, customization, you can select your npc island friends (be on the look out for rares), collecting, building, etc. I first tested it out on my step daughter's copy, soon I knew I had to buy my own! Very satisfied with my purchase.
title: One Of The Best Games I've Played

author: Brian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020
review_content: This game was definitely a relief for my wife and I during this pandemic and quarantine.As an avid video gamer, I absolutely adored this title throughout this year - building my own island from scratch and inviting my favorite villagers to my island, farming my own garden with variety of flowers and trees.My wife, who dislikes games in general, also fell in love with this game. We sat down together and discussed how to build and decorate our island and the whole experience was genuinely enjoyable and memorable.I highly recommend this game to anyone who owns a Nintendo Switch. Any age. Any gender. Anyone.
title: BEST FAMILY FRIENEDLY GAME

author: Momo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020
review_content: I got this game for my nine year old daughter and I must say, I found myself addicted to this game. The game is perfect for the kiddos and adults. The characters are sweet and humble. It’s so refreshing to play a game that doesn’t have shooting or dirty language. Fair warning to those who have multiple children. There is NOT an option to create multiple islands. Players will have to share the same island if playing on one devise. You’ll have to buy another game or another console in order to have your own island creation, which is ridiculous in my opinion.
title: Addicting game that could use an upgrade

author: Ramses B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2021
review_content: Since my girlfriend and I are law students, it’s hard to not only focus on something non-academic, but also to enjoy focusing on something non-academic due to the feeling of not being fully dedicated to your studies. I’m other words, my girlfriend has had trouble finding a guilty pleasure while in law school and her daily routine was starting to make me wish I could help give her a hobby. It turned out, Animal Crossing was the very right hobby for her. As soon as she started playing it she could not find enough hours in the day to play it to her fill, even though managing her islands is now a part-time job for her now. Her passion and creativity has manifested itself through the game, and I’m eternally grateful for the developers of this game giving her that kind of happiness.
title: My Girlfriend Loves It!

author: Jodi Grayson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2021
review_content: Ok this is a good little game but I'm not giving it all stars because it takes a LOT of time to get it set up and ready to play. My brain was shot by the time I got it ready to play. Like at least an hour of setting up and reading! That's to much this is just a little game you shouldn't need a degree to set it up and figure out what your supposed to do. So pretty much, it's a good little game but it takes a long time to get it there and it should be MUCH easier and quicker!
title: Good game but way to much set up!

author: Jordan Willis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
review_content: This is a fantastic animal crossing game, it's quite possibly the best in the series. There's sooo many huge quality of life improvements that make the game less tedious to play. You no longer have to slowly switch tools one at a time, there's a quick menu for them now. You can easily cross water, home customization is now far better, you can place furniture almost anywhere outside, you can move buildings if you don't like their location, you can modify water and terrain, the museum is absolutely amazing now, the game is visually amazing. etc etc etc. The only complaint I have with the game is some currently missing content that I'm hopeful will be improved on and added later as updates, as Nintendo has stated the game will be getting free updates.I will mention however, be weary if you're purchasing the game with the intent of having multiple people play it on the same system. Multiple players can play the game on one system, but must share an island together, thus giving those additional players a comparitvely limited experience. Hopefully Nintendo decides this was a bad move (it is very much a bad move) and allows multiple islands soon.
title: An amazing game, but be warned if you more than person will be playing it on the same system.

author: Bob
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2021
review_content: Punishes you for not being able to play everyday, if you work, go to school, or do anything that takes large chunks of your time don't bother. I was only able to participate in only two seasonal bug/fish hunts due to working the whole weekend and it really sucks not being able to time travel back because they update the game to stop you from "cheating" I'm sure my time traveling to being able to participate in something FOR ONCE really downgraded "others experience"
title: Not Fun for Long

author: Ariel Basham
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2020
review_content: I've never lost interest in an Animal Crossing game as quickly as this one. The new mechanic of crafting and terraforming does not make up for all the items and characters they removed from previous games. It seems they're trying to patch things in later, but it still isn't as good as New Leaf on the 3DS. Hell, I hold the controversial opinion that Pocket Camp (you know, the app) is a better Animal Crossing game than New Horizons.
title: New Leaf was better

author: Alexia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2020
review_content: One island per console is stupid. Does Nintendo expect us to buy a switch for everyone who wants to play that doesn’t want to get locked down by sharing an island? This is absurd.
title: Can’t recommend the game due to poor practices

author: MooU22
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2020
review_content: First of all, it's not worth the price if you don't already pay for Nintendo's subscription service (which is a whole separate BS issue). You would be paying 60 bucks for a game with a lot of content designed to be shared. As others have said, it's trying to force families into buying MULTIPLE switches, which is absurd. It has all the loading screens and repetition of text as its predecessors, but is infinitely more expensive and troublesome. My hindsight advice is, stick to the old titles unless/until some of these things have been addressed (but know that change is unlikely). The previous CEO of Nintendo who kept a lot of these issues at bay before, died, and they didn't even wait for him to be gone long before they went crazy with anticonsumer stuff.
title: Stick to older titles

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2021
review_content: I've never played an Animal Crossing game before this (except Pocket Camp, to see if I'd like it), so I had the advantage of not missing many aspects that had been removed. I also bought this game just for myself, so the fact that there is only one island per gaming console didn't bother me, but I have no doubt that it would if I intended for the game to be shared. Other reviews for this game will probably give you a better idea of whether or not this is a good purchase.
title: Never played an Animal Crossing Game before this

author: Samantha
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2020
review_content: Pre-ordered this game and it arrived the same day of the release day and it’s been 4 months since I’ve had animal crossing new horizons and I love it. I recommend this game because it’s so relaxing so therapeutic and adorable, you get to use your imagination and be as creative as you want with your island. This game doesn’t make you feel stressed you go at your own pace and the updates have been making the game even better and there’s still even more updates to come. This is a perfect gift for Nintendo fans and for the old animal crossing fans who have been here since the beginning of this franchise. If you plan on buying this game as a birthday gift or Christmas gift go for it, I’m sure your kids,friends, or anyone from your family that’s a Nintendo fan will be so happy.
title: Amazing game

author: MaryC22
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2020
review_content: I’ve always been a huge fan of AC! I was so excited when they first announced this one. It came out perfect timing since a lot of us are spending most of our time at home. It’s very relaxing and a great escape from the real world. (which I think everyone really needs right now) I love all the new addictions to the game but at the same time love that it still feels like old animal crossing games. They kept all the great stuff and added more! Nintendo did a fantastic job!
title: So much fun

author: Nicole Hudson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2020
review_content: My daughter is 100%, over the moon, stars in her eyes in love with this game. Anytime she's gotten free time to play with her new Switch Lite, this is her go-to game.It's cute, wholesome, and I like that I'm not having to constantly watch over her shoulder to make sure nothing wildly inappropriate is about to jump out of the woodwork. I'm a Nintendo fan in general because my personal preference is games that look and feel like games, not warzones, and Animal Crossing definitely doesn't disappoint there.
title: Cute, Wholesome, and Fun

author: Anna S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2020
review_content: As a lifelong Animal Crossing fan (Animal Crossing for the GameCube released when I was about 9), this is already my favorite installment since the original. Nintendo has managed to keep so much of the original nostalgia while adding in lots of new features. I love the addition of the crafting aspect that can add a bit of problem-solving to an otherwise straightforward life simulator. As always, it's absolutely adorable and I cannot stop playing and improving my island. Awesome job, Nintendo!
title: Best Animal Crossing Installment?

author: Brady and his bunch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2020
review_content: This game is incredible! It’s very relaxing, a nice change of pace from the crazy games out there today. The graphics are incredible and beautiful, and this game is a great way to play with your friends during social distancing via Nintendo online. This game is a great way to pass time while stuck inside during quarantine and the music in the game is very soothing and fun! The characters are also SO CUUUTE!!!! I grew up playing the animal crossing ds games and I’m very happy to say, this game definitely did them justice. I’m also very happy that they brought back some old characters, but also introduced a few new ones! It’s very exciting to see all the new features in this game that weren’t available in the previous ones and I’m excited to see what’s in store for the game. :)
title: Incredible game, definitely worth it!!

author: Leah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2020
review_content: This is my first animal crossing game and I feel like we got it for the perfect time! (#Quarantine2020) I would say it is a slow-paced game and somehow it tends to take up a lot of time.  The only gripe that I have with this game is that the 2 player mode is not very efficient and not very fun to play.  The second player who is not the main player is very limited on the actions that they can do and it’s just very inefficient so my husband and I just tend to play separately.  We do enjoy the game though.
title: Enjoyable but 2 player mode sucks

author: KB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2020
review_content: Though it wasn't planned that way (or was it!? kidding!) the timing of this release could not have been better. We got our game 2 weeks into our stay-home plan and have enjoyed building the island up every day. It is a great little escape for anyone in our house who just wants to relax and chill out for a bit. An easy way to build a "perfect" in-control little pretend life while the world is so chaotic. Have always loved AC games, and this one is no exception!
title: Perfect Pandemic Timing

author: Cindy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2021
review_content: Some of you gamers might know this already but if you stay up at 3:33am you will see an alien on your TV your your gameFun fact I thought y’all should know but other than that great game 10 out of 10 but I just wish the villagers had more personalities and things to say like in past games but it’s still good
title: Game secret and review

author: the tie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2020
review_content: The perfect companion during quarantine.  The game offers so many great features, such as the ability to customize and place furniture outside, and the ability to design an island to fit whatever theme your heart desires.The game starts a bit slow for people who are into fast pace action, but I find after a long day at work, the pace was very relaxing.  Once you unlock the ability to customize and landscape/terraform, you could very well spend 8 hours straight just doing that, so pace yourself!I'd love to see more custom design slots, more house storage, and more varied villager interaction, but based on what I've heard from others, this is the strongest entry in the series so far, and they keep releasing updates that may or may not address these things in the future.
title: The right game at the right time

author: Johnny Bernard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2020
review_content: I like how casual it is. It's a nice game to play when you want to be relaxed
title: the game is fun

author: Brandon Yee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2020
review_content: I bought this game to try it out. I am more of a first-person shooter gamer, i.e., Call of Duty, Battlefront. I saw more and more people talking about Animal Crossing and was curious to try it out. It surprised me how much I did not need a shooter to make this game appealing. The tarantulas and wasps provide the thrills in the game. The music is very nostalgic. The real-world mechanics like paying off a mortgage and stalks is cool. The game also plays in real-time, so there is always something to do. There are a lot of activities. I am planning on giving a theme to my town now. It's fun trading with friends and visiting their islands. There's so much more to explore.
title: The game I didn't know I needed!

author: Erika Lynn McLeod
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2020
review_content: My game is here, despite the delay surrounding the COVID-19 pandemic. I have no issues with the game, in fact I'm so excited to start my island! The graphics are beautiful, the game play I've seen by content creators and other game enthusiasts looks amazing! There are people that dislike the "one island per switch feature," but I'm the only one playing it in my household so even that doesn't bother me! My only real issue with the game was the transaction and delivery of the product. I understand why it was delayed, and at first it wasn't an issue, but then for Amazon to deliver my switch screen protector on the 19th (2 days after I ordered it,) I was frustrated. For those that may not have experienced this, my game was delayed to prioritized medical and home supplies. I now don't understand why they delayed my pre-ordered game, but delivered my screen protector 2 days after I purchased it. I've been waiting for this game. The screen protector, while important, wasn't nearly as anticipated as this game - it didn't cost nearly what the game did either. If medical and home supplies are so important my screen protector should have been delayed too. I'll never purchase another pre-order, or game for that matter, through Amazon.
title: My game has finally been delivered, but...

author: unknown
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2020
review_content: Good game but the box came bent and cracked. I don't want to send it back after it's already 3 days late on what was said to be a release day delivery. Sucks.
title: Good game, bad delivery

author: Pres_Church
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
review_content: This was my first Animal Crossing game and honestly, I absolutely love it. I play games with a lot of action and chaos so it's nice to pop in a game that's a little more mundane, even if I only have a few things to do in the game that day. The game has lots of charm, it's fun and it's a joy to see the island become more and more lively
title: Time to chill

author: Fran
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2020
review_content: I love love love Animal Crossing, I’ve been playing since Wild World came out back in the day. I remember while playing City Folk on my Wii, i had this fantasy of one day being able to construct your own town and make roads and choose where your stores go, and this game has fulfilled that fantasy <3 The animal villagers are sooo cute i love them, and i’m so happy to see some familiar faces like Blathers, KK Slider and Isabelle again.  Not to mention it’s beautiful and there’s so much detail in everything, from the way the shadows change throughout the day, to the way flowers blow around in the wind. I look forward to waking up to play this, and then play for hours, sometimes solo and sometimes with friends online. I have been waiting for so long and I am so happy with this game!I deducted a full star because yes, it is lame that you can only have one town per console, even if you do switch profiles on the switch.
title: Love!!! :D

author: Isabella
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2020
review_content: My son has clocked nearly 300 hours since receiving for Christmas... I think that says it all 😂😂 He REALLY loves the game!
title: Fabulous!

author: Amy Wiley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020
review_content: This is my 8 year old's game, but I started playing it and now I like it better than he does.  It's relaxing to me.  I think it's the background music and all you really have to do in the game is whatever you want- go fishing, pick weeds, pick up wood, build things, decorate, etc.  It is probably not good for anyone much younger than 8 because it is a lot of reading.  Nice little game though.  No violence or bad stuff at all.
title: Even fun for adults

author: Steve
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2021
review_content: An easy two player option is needed. Bought for my girls to play together. After multiple youtube tutorials, my 10yo has been playing for over an hour to get some in-game "phone" to allow 2 player while my 6 year old is left out. I should be about halfway to a PhD on this game by now. Lame, Nintendo!
title: 2 player requires hours of work

author: Saltwater Soul
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2020
review_content: I’ve basically given my life over to this game since quarantine. I had just bought a Nintendo Lite, I bought 7 other games to play and keep myself occupied while stuck in the house... and I haven’t played any of them but this one. It’s consumed me. It’s so fun and immersive. Never played a game like it! I really enjoy it, but have one huge gripe. The in game music is AWFUL. And you can’t turn it off. It’s just always on. And you need to have sound on to hear prompts in the game... so it’s turned into a bit of torture the further into the game I’ve gotten. Nintendo needs to fix this ASAP!!
title: I think Nintendo timed this for the Apocalypse.

author: Sammy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2020
review_content: Let's get this outta the way, I don't play MP so I don't care what people are experiencing in that area. My ONLY hate about this game is the durability of the tools. Apparently even gold tools break, and that sucks. However, the music, the villagers, and well, the entire game is just... wow.
title: Best Animal Crossing of all time!

author: Christina Hoang
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2020
review_content: Graphics are great and concept is the same but still as entertaining as it was from day 1. It's a game where you can play as long as several hours or can be as short as 15 minutes a day. They continuously come out with updates to keep the game interesting (as of Dec 2020) which is great! You can go visit other people's islands and interact with others but you need to both have the Nintendo online subscription. Although it can be played solo, it is more enjoyable to play with a community of people.
title: Fun, adorable, and an easy going game

author: Jenna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2020
review_content: We got Animal Crossing for our teenage daughters 14th birthday because she's been wanting it for awhile (along with a switch). She plays this game every single day for a few hours and always has great things to say about it! I'd much rather her be playing something like this than on her phone or internet in general. She really enjoys this game and already loves a lot of the characters!
title: Teenage daughter loves this game!

author: Erin Casey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2020
review_content: I went into this game with hesitations about it. I didn’t like the graphics too much at first and I feared the game was really starting to stray from the core of Animal Crossing.But when I started playing New Horizons for the first time, about an hour into it I really started to fall in love with the game and I realized that Nintendo is still being true to the core of Animal Crossing. I am addicted now. I love how much they have added, there is a lot to do. I ended up liking the graphics too. Music is subpar but I think that’s because I love the Gamecube and Wild World soundtracks lol.Definitely worth buying, it is potentially even better than New Leaf.And yes, it is one island per console but that was how it was with City Folk so I’m not sure why everyone is so outraged
title: As good or better than New Leaf

author: Juan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2020
review_content: 8yr old daughter asked me to buy her the Nintendo switch because she wanted to play Animal crossing, because she didn't like it on her ipad. So my husband and I decided to but it for her. Once we received the items we opened everything and started to play the animal crossing game. My husband things it's a good game because she is excited to keep on reading.
title: Playing and Reading

author: Beth Cave
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2021
review_content: We started playing this years ago when it was on the Wii. Kids were under 10. Now they are 18 and 17 and even I still play the game. It is relaxing and gives you items you must do.  Great learning tool or just plain fun
title: Awesomeness.

author: J's Purchases
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2021
review_content: My daughter is 9 and and kinda gave up on the game. It created these high stress situations where she has to be in the game at a certain time to complete task and it started interfering with real life stuff that is more important. It was starting to stress her out and she would panic that she need to be in the game at 6;30 etc  and really be bummed out when she missed the times.
title: Daughter loved it for 30 days

author: Melissy Bee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2021
review_content: After being a huge fan of this franchise for many years, I am happy to say that this is the BEST Animal Crossing yet! You have the ultimate ability to be creative with your land, furniture, villagers, and even clothing. You can interact online with friends, and even make new friends. The best part is how quality the graphics are. This game is really beautiful to look at! Yay! :)
title: This game is so much fun!

author: K. Facchini
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020
review_content: Been playing since release day. Please send help. My island is 5 stars, I have the cutest villagers, and a lovely garden. But I've also stopped paying my real life bills. My rent is past due, my car got repo'd, and I think they're looking to shut my water and gas off here in the next few days. My wife was threatening to leave me, until I got her to also play the game with me, now she wont leave. Silver linings, I guess.
title: Send help

author: Jason Shulze
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2020
review_content: This is a great game, and I truly think it could go down as one of the greats. However Nintendo's money driven decision to only allow only 1 island per console, is seen as a blatant attempt to sell more Switches. DO NOT under any circumstances buy this if more than one person plans to play the game on the same console. Nintendo will not receive another dime from me or a better review from me until they fix this obvious attempt to extort more money from their customers.
title: Great game, hindered by one unbelievably stupid decision on Nintendo's part.

author: Mike
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2020
review_content: The number of times you press the A button to perform basic tasks is so high that my wife's thumb has been hurting lately. The excessive length of cutscenes to join a friend's island, or to watch a friend join your island, discourages group play or play with strangers, and the whole game feels poorly designed.There are regular patches reacting to the top 1% of players exploiting bank interest rates, certain high value commodities, and other mechanics. Nintendo is doing copyright strikes against Youtube videos and reporters discussing these issues. There are fan-made videos showcasing quality of life features that.. it's frankly sad none of them existed from the beginning (and likely won't).
title: Repetition

author: pennamed
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2020
review_content: A wonderful game, as long as you're okay with the slow pacing you'll love this game. I was initially scared off by the strange pov, but you get used to it as you play. The best thing about it is that there's always something new to do and that the time/date in game syncs up with real time so you can enjoy the seasonal events and changes. Charming, cute, and cozy, fun for all ages.
title: A cute, slow paced game, perfect for your quarantine impulse buy

author: Jessica G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2021
review_content: My children are absolutely obsessed with this game. Honestly, this was possibly the best holiday gift that they’ve ever received. I have never seen them play with some thing as much as this game. The whole one island thing was kind of a bummer when we first got the game, but now they’ve learned to share and be better about like not messing with each other stuff within the game.
title: My kids are OBSESSED.

author: Carpe Diem
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2020
review_content: I didn't expect that this could be so boring. Disappointed..
title: Kind of boring

author: Burny
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2020
review_content: If your kid likes games that are simple and loves to read then your kid would probably enjoy this. If your kid likes games like fortnite and other intense and more active games than this one will be very boring. Bought this for my son's birthday. He tried it once and never played it again after that. Just wasted $59. Don't understand why this game is so expensive
title: Boring game

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2021
review_content: Yeeeaaah so I stole this game from my 9 year old.... and not ashamed of it!! Haha! Bought the switch and animal crossing for my kid for Christmas and my husband now calls it mine. Poor kid barely gets to play it! I’m so obsessed with this game that I had to start giving myself allotted time to play bc I would play it literally all day long on days off and wouldn’t get anything done! Lol! I’m not even a gamer and never have been but I can’t go a day without at least playing for an hour... or four... hehe... BUY IT!  ....unless u don’t want to get hooked!
title: Parents might steal it from kids!!

author: Liz B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
review_content: A great game to spend quarantine playing. World building and having friends while catching fish and butterflies. Ideal world in 2020. Bonus: no masks (unless you want to and then you can buy a mask in game...which sadly doesn’t reach all the way up the nose)
title: Good entertainment for quarantine

author: Liselle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2021
review_content: I started playing this game on the 3DS as Animal Crossing New Leaf. I had been wanting to get a Switch but kept holding off until I watched a friend stream ACNH and actually purchased the AC Switch and game that same day. I haven't regretted it for a second!! This adorable little game lets you interact with your villagers and the detail (especially in the clothing) is VASTLY improved from New Leaf!
title: Definitely not just for kids!! (I'm a 50+year old grandmother!)

author: nicholas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020
review_content: My wife and I were hoping to spend this quarantine playing a fun cooperative game together. Unfortunately local multiplayer is a complete joke, and essentially makes anyone but "Player 1" pointless.
title: Horrible Local Play

author: jennjewell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
review_content: That's it.  It's just super repetitive and boring.  So many meaningless presses of the A button just to get through those inane interactions with the Nooks and residents.  I don't mind the collecting or the tasks to advance the island - but the whole act of selling, banking, donating?  It's painful.  I've got nothing but time on my hands and if I'm going to spend it playing games?  It's not going to be this one.
title: Yawn

author: Free Beck
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2020
review_content: Our 8 year old daughter bought this with her own money that she saved. She really loves playing it, she loves all the exploration and adventure the game has to offer. We like it because the game has a fair amount of reading so she is able to expand her reading vocabulary as well. Highly recommend for a younger child who’s able to read at least a little bit.
title: Great game for our 8 year old girl - she loves it!

author: M. Newman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
review_content: I played the original game on the GameCube, and this feels the most like that game. I had Animal Crossing on the GBA and Wii, but this finally returned to the roots of the original.It's an amazing game that will occupy your entire life. So long, productivity. You will not be missed.
title: Feels like the GameCube Game

author: A.Prime.Shopper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020
review_content: This came out just when we needed it. It is a simple game to understand, and on the surface level, there isn't much to it. However, they paid attention to the details (like different sounding footsteps when you walk on different surfaces or have different footwear). It is absolutely charming and a nice escape from dealing with the real world for a little while.
title: Fantastic game - very calming

author: HappyShopperJoyce
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2021
review_content: Animal Crossing is a very popular game and I got it for my daughter with a gift card she had from her credit card reward points. She plays it whenever she has time off and enjoys it a great deal, in fact she connects with her sister and her friends that also have it and visit one another's island. They are trying to get me to play as well but I do not have a Switch yet. It looks like fun and they both give it 5 stars so I have to say that I would too. It is a great way to pass the time during this pandemic and stay safe at home also. Amazon prices are very comparable with any other company or store. Definitely well worth the cost and I would buy it myself if I had a Switch for me.
title: Great game for anyone

author: Janine
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2020
review_content: I don't know what you're talking about. All my friends are right here in this tiny screen. No viruses here.Is a 'Covid' some sort of bug? I don't think I've donated that one to Blathers yet.10/10, No need to go outside anymore.
title: Qurantine...? COVID...?

author: Thomas A. Sweeney Jr.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2020
review_content: This game is uber, uber addictive.  Once you start playing, it's very difficult to shut it down.  It looks great on the switch and is as fun and playable as earlier additions.  This game is so good that I ended up buying a second switch and another copy of this game so both kids could play at once.  One of, if not the best game on the switch at the moment.
title: Don't buy this if you don't have time to play!

author: Grandma Nana
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2021
review_content: So disappointed...purchased in August ...opened it 4 days ago...the villagers stop communicating after three days.Ugh.Next day update...since I did not know what to do with this defect...I search the web on the product...did a "soft reboot  product now working fine... did not have a new switch to test it out in August.
title: Stop working after 3 days...glitch forced me to find solution on the web

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2020
review_content: This is a one person game.  Do not make the mistake like I did and think that it will be ok and your kids can share the island.  They cannot.  It will lead to fights and arguments.  I bought this for my 15 year old daughter to play and she was perfectly happy for a couple of weeks until her older sister decided she wanted to play as well.  Although they can both live on the island, one person is always really in control of what is built and goes on.  Might be ok if your kids are little and don’t know any better.
title: Really a one player game

author: Kyrie Bass
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
review_content: This is not a multiplayer game. It's not even a game that more than one person in your household can play by themselves. You have to share an island. My son is 6, imagine sharing an island with a 6 year old? If I want to join him, we have to constantly switch leader because for some reason, if you're not the leader, you can literally do NOTHING. ON top of that, I got my game two days ago a d paid $65. Now it's $50??? Must be from all of the bad reviews! I'm hoping for an update to FIX THESE IMPORTANT ISSUES!
title: Not intended for more than one player

author: Jeff Underhill
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
review_content: This game's release could not have come at a better time. It provides us a much needed break from the harsh realities of life right now. It's simple yet compelling game play make it a viable option for die hard or casual gamers alike. It's quite easy to get lost for hours in the variety of activities it has to offer. Also visiting friend's islands is a great social platform during all of the "stay at home' orders. Thank you Nintendo!
title: The Break Form Reality We All Need Right Now

author: Avid reader
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020
review_content: I do not understand all the hype surrounding this game. It is obnoxious, monotonous, and kind of annoying. Good game for younger children, not for adults. I bought it based on the glowing reviews, gave it a few plays, then promptly sent it back. Maybe just not my cup of tea?
title: Not my cup of tea

author: Tatia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2021
review_content: This seems to be a bootleg copy of the game.  I’ve purchased a second switch and game cartridge from Target, and it’s completely different, and way better, from this version.  I wish I would have known that before I spent a couple of months playing this one.  Buyer beware!  Buy your game cartridge from a name brand store.
title: Something fishy here...

author: Andrew LeBlanc
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2020
review_content: Nintendo continues to dazzle its fanbase, old and new. The game is consistently rewarding, aesthetically pleasing, and forwardly fun. The game presents you with a new checklist of creative potential every day, and is truly a game where you get out what you put in. You want to discover fossils and donate to a museum to build a wonderland of exhibits? Check. You want to befriend your fellow villagers and learn recipes to craft new furniture? Check. You want to completely change the image of your island to your liking through inspiration? Check check check. Seriously fun for gamers who like a calmer, unique style to interior and exterior design, fun discovery, and adorable characters!
title: Adorable Game, Relaxing Gameplay, Sense of accomplishment on high

author: Bill Fisher
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020
review_content: Best version of animal crossing to date.  The crafting is fun.  I really liked the progression aspect of the game compared to older entries.  Nook Miles system makes it easy to feel like you accomplished something and gives you a reason to do things you normally wouldn't mess with or know you should mess with.Play it with friends and family, just be prepared to buy them their own copies if you have multiple Nintendo Switches  in your house.
title: Awesome Game

author: Lindsay Marie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2020
review_content: I believe this is the 2nd or 3rd animal crossing I have bought to get people (my friends) into Animal Crossing. AND BY GOD ILL BUY IT AGAIN! Let me tell YOU! This is THE most important game in gaming history.
title: LOVE THIS GAME!

author: Red Lady
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2021
review_content: Just bought the switch system for when we go camping.  Now if I could only figure out how to play this game.  I only wish that they would come with instructions on how to play the games.  Yes I am old and I did try to have my 7 year old grandson show me but I still can't figure it out.  It's u tube time.
title: Very popular game

author: Emil Adrias
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2020
review_content: I love this game! I pre-ordered this for a gift to myself and it arrived only a couple days after it released with no problems whatsoever. The game had no issues installing/reading on my Switch and it hasn't had any problems so far! I really love my island right now. Super fun to pass the time and create cool stuff during the quarantine.
title: So addicted!

author: Janet
